DataElement.preferredName: AML Recurrent Refractory Disease Or Newly Diagnosed Or Negation Treatment Agreement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow clinical study participation that are related to recurrent/refractory AML, or newly diagnosed AML, or the patientÂ’s non-agreement to treatment as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Recurrent Disease Refractory Disease Or Newly Diagnosed Or Negation Therapeutic Procedure Agreement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification)._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A disease that resists treatment._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Very recently determined._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed/refractory AML (greater than or equal to 50% blasts in bone marrow or extramedullary leukemia); adverse cytogenetics, e.g., as defined by the Medical Research Council (MRC) Prognostic Groupings; secondary AML; organ dysfunction arising from significant co-morbidities not directly linked to leukemia; ECOG = 2) or not willing to undergo intensive chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have relapsed/refractory AML (greater than or equal to 5% blasts in bone marrow or extramedullary leukemia) adverse cytogenetics, e.g., as defined by the Medical Research Council (MRC) Prognostic Groupings; secondary AML; organ dysfunction arising from significant co-morbidities not directly linked to leukemia; ECOG = 2) or not willing to undergo intensive chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have AML in first relapse with bone marrow sample showing greater than or equal to 1 percent leukemic blasts by flow cytometry?
